**update**: I've done some additional research - it seems like 'Samādhirāja' was actually translated into Chinese in different ways over time... including "Xian Ming Jin Lun", then another later Chinese translation being from the lost original Sanskrit: 
'Samadhijnarmaoccana', this possibly led to "T1298, 'Bai yi Mo Nan Lun’ which is a Tibetan version; in Sanskrit, also named 'Arya-Sandhinirmocana-Suta', which finally gets us to... "Arya Sandhinirmocana nairmanthara dharani ".
